detected_issues.description: ACE inhibitor (Lisinopril) + Potassium supplement - hyperkalemia risk
detected_issues.reasoning: Patient on Lisinopril (ACE inhibitor) with new potassium chloride 20 mEq prescription. ACE inhibitors block aldosterone, causing potassium retention. Adding potassium supplement creates significant hyperkalemia risk, especially with baseline K+ 4.8 mEq/L and Stage 3 CKD. This combination can cause life-threatening cardiac arrhythmias.
